title: Railworks 4 Class 3700 with 'City of Truro'
description:
The distinctive Class 3700 locomotives are presented here in a set of authentic liveries and with different cabs depending on the era depicted. Also included is a set of  Clerestory and Just Trains Mk1 coaches, both with passenger view.
 
12 exciting custom scenarios (including some that require additional routes) complete the package!
 
The 'City of Truro' locomotive would become famous on May 9, 1904 when it was timed at 102.3 MPH while descending the 1-in-86 Whiteball bank with the Ã¢â‚¬ËœOcean MailsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ parcel service. The accuracy of this speed has been questioned and investigated a number of times, but the loco was certainly travelling in excess of 98 MPH when it passed Milepost 171 near Wellington in Somerset! If we believe the recording of Charles Rous-Marten it is certain that 3440 Ã¢â‚¬ËœCity of TruroÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ was the first steam locomotive to reach 100 MPH anywhere in the world. We have included a scenario to see if you can also get to this magic number!

LOCOMOTIVES
 

    3440 Ã¢â‚¬ËœCity of TruroÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ 2004-2006 version
    3700 Ã¢â‚¬ËœDurbanÃ¢â‚¬â„¢
    3704 Ã¢â‚¬ËœLytteltonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢
    3710 Ã¢â‚¬ËœCity of BathÃ¢â‚¬â„¢
    3716 Ã¢â‚¬ËœCity of LondonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢
    3717 Ã¢â‚¬ËœCity of TruroÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ (2010-2012)
    3717 Ã¢â‚¬ËœCity of TruroÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ (1912-1931)
    3719 Ã¢â‚¬ËœCity of ExeterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢

COACHES

Just Trains Mk1 coaches in brown and cream livery: Brake Standard Open, First Open, Tourist Standard Open

Clerestory coaches: Corridor Compartment, Corridor third, Right-hand brake coach, Left-hand brake coach
